title: Nair Tiknizyan
text:
Nair Oganesovich Tiknizyan (; ; born 12 May 1999) is a Russian <a href="association%20football">football</a> player of <a href="Armenians%20in%20Russia">Armenian</a> descent. He plays as a <a href="left-back">left-back</a> for <a href="FC%20Lokomotiv%20Moscow">FC Lokomotiv Moscow</a>. He also plays at <a href="left%20midfielder">left midfielder</a>.
Official sources such as <a href="UEFA">UEFA</a> or <a href="Russian%20Premier%20League">Russian Premier League</a> list his first name as Nayair (). The clerk who issued his birth certificate made a mistake which has been perpetuated in all official documents since. Tiknizyan himself said he can not find the time to officially petition for a change of name.
Club career.
CSKA Moscow.
Tiknizyan made his debut for the main squad of <a href="PFC%20CSKA%20Moscow">PFC CSKA Moscow</a> on 20 September 2017 in a <a href="Russian%20Cup%20%28football%29">Russian Cup</a> game against <a href="FC%20Avangard%20Kursk">FC Avangard Kursk</a>. He made his second appearance on 10 October 2018 in a <a href="Russian%20Cup%20%28football%29">Russian Cup</a> game against <a href="FC%20Tyumen">FC Tyumen</a>.
On 9 January 2019, CSKA Moscow announced that Tiknizyan had signed a new contract with the club until the summer of 2022.
He made his <a href="Russian%20Premier%20League">Russian Premier League</a> debut for CSKA on 25 August 2019 in a game against <a href="FC%20Akhmat%20Grozny">FC Akhmat Grozny</a>, as a 89th-minute substitute for <a href="Ivan%20Oblyakov">Ivan Oblyakov</a>.
On 20 January 2020, Tiknizyan moved on loan to <a href="FC%20Avangard%20Kursk">Avangard Kursk</a> until the end of the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20PFC%20CSKA%20Moscow%20season">2019–20 season</a>.
On 11 September 2020, Tiknizyan extended his contract with CSKA until the end of the 2024–25 season.
FC Lokomotiv Moscow.
On 4 August 2021, <a href="FC%20Lokomotiv%20Moscow">Lokomotiv Moscow</a> announced the signing of Tiknizyan on a five-year deal.
